page.title: 07ST. MICHAEL'S CHURCH
page.content:
St. Michaels Church was built in the 7th century in Saxon times. In the baptistry of the church, there are 4 fragments of carved stones standing on a large Norman block. These fragments are the remains of the Saxon crosses, whichhave remained from those early days. They were a gathering place for the Saxons, andthe church was probably wooden. After the conquest,the Normans smashed down the crosses and replaced them with a stone church, with proper The Noman church, a very strong building like a fortress, was built in
1100 AD. All of the ancestors of the local Curwen family are buried here, some in stone tombs with carved figures on top. The church can accommodate 1000 people
